security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance on DevOps best practices. All 28 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES triggered by documentation references that the pattern matcher misclassified. The skill contains no executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond reading its own file. The skill-report.json explicitly lists zero risk factors and the audit confirms it is safe to publish.

content.value_statement: This skill helps teams establish consistent code quality standards. It provides guidance on linting rules, version control workflows, and CI/CD practices to improve code reliability and maintainability.
actual_capabilities: Enforces ESLint configuration for code quality
Covers testing strategies for unit and E2E tests
limitations: Does not execute linting or testing commands automatically
Does not modify project configuration files
Does not connect to CI/CD services or APIs
Does not manage secrets or credentials

use_cases.title: Establish code standards
use_cases.description: Set up consistent linting rules and code quality checks across your development team.

use_cases.title: Design CI/CD pipelines
use_cases.description: Plan GitHub Actions workflows that run lint and build checks on every pull request.

use_cases.title: Learn best practices
use_cases.description: Understand proper version control workflow and commit message conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Setup linting
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I configure ESLint with strict type checking for my TypeScript project?

prompt_templates.title: Semantic commits
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the semantic commit message format? Give me examples for features, fixes, and documentation changes.

prompt_templates.title: CI pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I set up GitHub Actions to run npm run lint and npm run build on every pull request?

prompt_templates.title: Secrets handling
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the best practices for managing secrets locally and in production environments? How do I avoid committing secrets?

output_examples.input: How do I set up GitHub Actions for CI?
output: Trigger workflow on push to main and pull requests
Run npm install, npm run lint, and npm run build steps
Use matrix strategy for testing across Node versions
Store test results and build artifacts for debugging
Types: feat for new features, fix for bug fixes
Other types: docs, style, refactor, test, chore
Example: feat(auth): add user login validation

output_examples.input: How do I avoid committing secrets?
output: Never commit API keys, tokens, or passwords
Use environment variables in production (Vercel, etc.)
Use git hooks to scan for secrets before commit

best_practices: Run linting before every commit to catch issues early in development
Use semantic commit messages for clear changelog generation and team coordination
Never commit .env files or secrets to version control systems
anti_patterns: Skipping lint checks to save time during development phases
Committing sensitive data like API keys or passwords to the repository
Merging code without running build and test steps in CI pipeline

faq.question: Which linting tools are supported?
faq.answer: This skill covers ESLint configuration for JavaScript and TypeScript projects with strict type checking enabled.

faq.question: What commit message format should I use?
faq.answer: Use semantic commits with format: type(scope): description. Types include feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, test, and chore.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Create GitHub Actions workflows that run npm install, npm run lint, and npm run build on every pull request to main branch.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads its own documentation and provides guidance. It does not access files, execute code, or transmit data externally.

faq.question: Why is my build failing after enabling strict linting?
faq.answer: Strict linting enforces type safety. Fix type errors by adding proper TypeScript types, using noImplicitAny, and resolving all lint warnings.

faq.question: How does this compare to other DevOps skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on code quality and CI/CD fundamentals. It complements deployment skills by establishing quality gates before code reaches production.
